g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
Emerging policy perspectives on systemic transformations
Because of the multiple market, government, system, and other failures that are associated with the
energy system, a range of policy interventions are usually required to enab
introduction of new technologies in the market
Wüstenhagen 2009; Veugelers 2012; Negro et al. 2012; Weber a
(Rogge and Reichardt 2016; Rogge et al. 2020; Edmondson et al. 2020, 2019)
rical research shows that when in the energy and environment space new technologies were
developed and introduced in the market, it was usually at least partly as a result of a range of policies
(Nemet 2019a; Bunn et al. 2014; Rogge and Reichardt 2016;
year innovation journey of solar PV, covering multiple countries, which is reviewed
Sources of cost reductions in solar photovoltaics
No single country persisted in developing solar PV
. Five countries each made a distinct
contribution. Each leader relinquished its lead. The free flow of ideas, people, machines, finance,
and products across countries explains the success of solar photovoltaics (PV). Barriers to
Solar PV has attracted interest for decades, and until recently was seen as an intriguing novelty, serving
a niche, but widely dismissed as a serious answer to climate change and other social problems associated
with energy use. Since AR5, PV has be
technology that has generated trade disputes among superpowers, threatened the solvency of large
energy companies, and prompted reconsideration of electric utility regulation rooted in the 1930s. More
avourably, its continually falling costs and rapid adoption are improving air quality and facilitating
climate change mitigation. PV is now so inexpensive that it is important in an expanding set of countries.
In 2020, 41 countries, in 6 continents, had in
stalled at least 1GW of solar each
g electricity from solar PV is now lower in sunny locations than running existing
. Prices in 2020 were below where even the most
optimistic experts expected they would be in 2030.
The costs of solar PV modules have fallen by more than a factor of 10,000 since they were first
agnitude cost reduction from the first commercial
application in 1958 until 2018 can be summarised as the result of distinct contributions by the US,
Figure 1, PV improved as the result of:
s in the 1800s and early 1900s, in Europe and the US, that provided a
fundamental understanding of the ways that light interacts with molecular structures, leading to the
n junction to separate electrons and holes
A breakthrough at a corporate laboratory in the US in 1954 that made a commercially available PV
device available and led to the first substantial orders, by the US Navy in 1957
nd public procurement effort in the 1970s in the US, that entrained skilled
scientists and engineers into the effort and stimulated the first commercial production lines
